===Etymology===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|むかし}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=むかし}}. The ''muka'' portion derives from the {{m|ja|未然形|tr=mizenkei||incomplete form}} of verb {{m|ja|向く|tr=muku||to face opposite to something}}, implying “that which stands opposite from the present”. The ''shi'' portion is suffix {{m|ja|し|tr=shi}} indicating [[direction]], also found in words {{m|ja|縦し|tr=tatashi||the standing or vertical direction}}, {{m|ja|横し|tr=yokoshi||the sideways or horizontal direction}}. This appears to be a somewhat rare alternative form, more commonly encountered as {{m|ja|さ|tr=sa}}, and may be cognate with the nominalizing adjective ending {{m|ja|さ|tr=sa}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|むかし|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====

# the [[past]], [[old]] times
#* {{RQ:Utsubo Monogatari|Toshikage}}<ref>{{R:Utsubo Monogatari 1}}</ref>
#*: '''むかし'''、式部大輔、左大弁かけて清原の王ありけり。
#: 昔と[[今]] — past and the present
#: 昔の[[自分]] — my past self
#: 昔からの[[友達]] — a [[longtime]] friend ("a friend since old times")
#: 昔に[[戻る]] — to return to the past
# [[ancient]]
#: 昔の[[人]] — ancient people
#: もう昔の[[話]]だ。— That's [[ancient history]].
